pages.text: As the world is made up of lots of different stones, it might be confusing on how to get cobblestone. Cobblestone is obtained by crushing most igneous or metamorphic $(world/stones)stones$(). At the start, this is achieved by $(l:tools/hammers)Hammers$().

pages.title: Intrusive Igneous Stones
pages.text: As the title suggests there has been a tweak to the standard lava + water = cobblestone scheme. This tweak can be enabled/disabled in the config. By default, lava and flowing water will form a random intrusive igneous stones from Rankine. Using additional mineral blocks in the generator can allow for specific stone generation.

pages.title: Extrusive Igneous Stones
pages.text: As the title suggests there has been a tweak to the standard basalt generator. This tweak can be enabled/disabled in the config. By default, lava flowing into blue ice over soul soil will form a random extrusive igneous stones from Rankine. Using additional mineral blocks in the generator can allow for specific stone generation.

pages.title: Metamorphic Stones
pages.text: There has been a tweak to the standard stone generator. This tweak can be enabled/disabled in the config. By default, lava flowing onto water source blocks will form a random metamorphic stones from Rankine. Using additional stones in the generator can allow for specific stone generation.

pages.title: Sedimentary Stones
pages.text: Sedimentary stones are generated by the accumulation of granular material and compacted under pressure. To simulate this phenomena, the sediment fan will cause nearby areas to collect sediment. Place a water source block that has room to flow out 3 blocks at least.

Place the sediment fan under the water source block and each random tick a random sedimentary stone will be generated 3 blocks downstream. Using additional sediment blocks in the two blocks under the water and next to the fan can allow for specific stone generation.
